alexwilton.handwritingAssistant.exercises

Class Exercise

  • java.lang.Object
    • alexwilton.handwritingAssistant.exercises.Exercise
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlphabetExercise, HeadlineSentenceExercise, RecapExercise

    public abstract class Exercise
extends java.lang.Object
    Superclass for Exercise. An Exercise provides a learner with an handwriting instruction along with giving the learner feedback on how closely their handwritten strokes correspond with the expected text.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean caseSensitiveChecking
      Boolean for specifying whether a handwriting checking should be case sensitive.
      private java.util.Set<Word> highlightedWords
      Words the exercises wants to be highlighted
      protected java.lang.String instruction
      Instruction to be displayed to the leaner to inform them how to go about the task.
      private boolean showNoMistakesMessage
      Should a "No Mistakes Detected!" message currently be being shown.
      protected java.lang.String textToCopy
      Expected text which the learner should be writing.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> wordFormingFailCount
      Map for keeping track of the number of times a learner fails to form each word.

      • drawFeedback

        protected void drawFeedback(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draw feedback on graphics for learner. Highlights mis-written words and states what should have been written in blue and what was written underneath.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to draw feedback on.

      • drawLines

        protected void drawLines(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draw five horizontal lines to act as guide lines for the learner to write on.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to draw on.

      • calculateXforCentringString

        protected static int calculateXforCentringString(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                                                 java.lang.String strToCentre)
        Calculate x co-ordinate which would result in a string being centred.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics from which the font for rendering the string can be extracted
        strToCentre - String to be centred
        Returns:
        X Co-ordinate which will result in string being centred

      • generateFeedback

        public void generateFeedback(java.util.List<Word> recognisedWords,
                             StrokeAnalyser strokeAnalyser,
                             boolean recordFailedWordAttempts)
        Generate visual feedback for learner. Compare recognised words with expected words and highlight any differences.
        Parameters:
        recognisedWords - Ordered list of recognised words (created from analysed user strokes)
        strokeAnalyser - Stroke Analyser (allows a reattempt of stroke analysis in cases where the word separating distance is too large)
        recordFailedWordAttempts - Boolean whether failed attempts are recorded.
